metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7283 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The xfs_da3_fixhashpath function in fs/xfs/xfs_da_btree.c in the xfs implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.14.2 does not properly compare btree hash values, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (filesystem corruption, and OOPS or panic) via operations on directories that have hash collisions, as demonstrated by rmdir operations. Hannes Frederic Sowa reported a hash collision ordering problem in the xfs filesystem in the Linux kernel. A local user could exploit this flaw to cause filesystem corruption and a denial of service (oops or panic).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-27-generic - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-lowlatency - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-27-generic - 3.13.0-27.50
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1

linux-image-3.13.0-27-generic - 3.13.0-27.50
linux-image-3.13.0-27-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-27.50

linux-image-3.13.0-27-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-27.50

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.04 preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support per Debian, introduced in 3.10 reproducer: http://oss.sgi.com/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=xfs/cmds/xfstests.git;a=commitdiff;h=947ee8bd4b59770534297572b14c695e9c6e001e per apw, this was fixed in passing in 3.13.0-39.66~precise1, part of https://ubuntu.com/security/notices/USN-2394-1, but not documented in the changelog or the USN.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-27.50').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-27.50').
